meanings.definition: A structure found in prokaryotic cells that is involved in cell division.
meanings.sent1: The mesosome plays a crucial role in cell division.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the mesosome to understand how cells divide.
meanings.sent3: The mesosome in the cell was so excited to help with division, it did a little dance.
meanings.sent4: The mesosome is like the conductor of a cell division orchestra, ensuring everything runs smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the mesosome looks like a tiny, bustling city during rush hour.

meanings.definition: A region of the cell membrane in bacteria that is involved in respiration.
meanings.sent1: The mesosome helps bacteria breathe by facilitating respiration.
meanings.sent2: Bacteria rely on the mesosome for their respiratory processes.
meanings.sent3: The mesosome in the bacterial cell threw a party to celebrate its role in respiration.
meanings.sent4: In the world of bacteria, the mesosome is the lungs of the cell.
meanings.sent5: Without the mesosome, bacteria would struggle to take in oxygen and release carbon dioxide.

meanings.definition: A component of bacterial cells that helps maintain cell shape and structure.
meanings.sent1: The mesosome provides support to the bacterial cell, keeping its shape intact.
meanings.sent2: Maintaining cell structure is one of the key functions of the mesosome.
meanings.sent3: The mesosome in the bacterial cell acted like a superhero, holding up the cell walls.
meanings.sent4: Like a sturdy pillar, the mesosome holds the bacterial cell together.
meanings.sent5: Every bacterial cell relies on the mesosome to stay strong and structured.
